• Short Fiction, Poems

  • forthcoming CALYPSO, Piss Press

    When I took Na in, my dirt floor, I washed her hair with my mouth. What nefarious thick skin we had on, from our high immunity, from sucking every dish down.

  • forthcoming day one, Bombay Gin 49

    The tension between things that always were and my life finally happening is I can’t tell anyone, including my best friend. Bro, I say, the floods have sloshed me and my drive, officially making me a shut in.

  • Hack, Visible Binary

    Drying was not an act of will but an act of environment, being at odds with it. We took to odds easily, not wanting damp hair or cold wind...

  • Slat, Bombay Gin: SLIT LOOM

    with K. Blasco Soler, after Mahmoud Darwish

  • She Did Not Sing, The Poetry Project

    Who can resist a good container? Outlined in silver, the naked couple held hands. A small vine climbed each leg. I thumbed over the pair of sloping shoulders, thick backs, and flat cheeks...

  • Visit to Makon, Wildness

    “We can never go back,” I said softly, offering her a mantra, an antidote for keeping memory at bay. Even now, I hold those words close to my body, low, against the liver...

  • Movement, Performance, Workshop

  • residency double dutch with remy malik

    April 20 -26, 2025 | Counterpath - A choreopoem of - Objectivity in 3 Acts (4 if you’re paying attention) - Another present moves alongside the present expropriated from (us).

  • performance amplifies it, doubles, trebles it

    01.11.25 | SITE Santa Fe - Site-specific, multimedia performance series by kelechi agwuncha featuring transgenre, experimental sound artists, and performers. Also featuring Chuquimamani-Condori, Ryan Dennison and Ibrahima Fofana.

  • performance Sound Museum

    11.14.24 | Counterpath - A sound and theater performance of Poupeh Missaghi’s Sound Museum (Coffee House Press 2024), a theory fiction, with Brian Alarcon, Valerie Hsiung and Neshat Sadatmansoori.

    11.04.24 | The Poetry Project - Deep Study Session with Saretta Morgan

  • performance FATELESSNESS ON THE MEND, FATELESSNESS ON THE LAM

    F I V E S: Denver Quarterly

  • performance Alt-Nature

    03.18.24 | Counterpath - In celebration of Saretta Morgan’s book release, Alt-Nature from Coffee House Press, a performance with remy malik and Brian Alarcon. Watch here.

  • workshop Movement Workshops: slothing sleuthing, frantic assembly, body language, earthworks, blobjects in touch.

  • Writing, Projects

  • forthcoming abalone, Counterpath (2025)

    A poetry performance, object, and chapbook.
    “Day by day, one makes of a broken wall a place to stand. That is how to cross the rubble, call a friend, kill time. What I don’t have time to tell you becomes physical and what is physical will bear the load. It has to.” Preorder chapbook here ↗

  • finalist Squat Practice, Essay Press

    An essay-poem collection on tropical fecundity and density as coverage, 2024 Chapbook Contest.

  • finalist Nightlaps, Wendy’s Subway

    2024 Open Reading Period judged by Bhanu Kapil.

Bo Hwang is an artist and writer working in poetry and movement.
